com.xing.api.resources

Class JobsResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xing.api.Resource
      • com.xing.api.resources.JobsResource

  • public class JobsResource
extends Resource
    Represent the 'Jobs' resource.

    Provides methods which allow search for a Job's by id or search for a list of job's by criteria or recommended to a user by id.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.xing.api.Resource

        api, ME

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getJobById

        public CallSpec<Job,HttpError> getJobById(java.lang.String jobId)
        Returns a full Job posting. Full job postings contain the following fields in addition to minimal job postings (returned by jobs recommendations and jobs search ): level, job_type, industry, skills, tags, description. When the contact field is present, it contains either a company or a user. Warning: The company field does not contain a XING company profile in all cases. This means that the company, that posted the job, does not have a XING company profile. In this case the id field is null and the links field contains an empty object.

      • getJobsByCriteria

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<PartialJob>,HttpError> getJobsByCriteria(java.lang.String criteria)
        Returns a list of PartialJob postings that match the given criteria. A minimal job posting consists of the fields id, title, company, location, contact, published_at and links. If you want to return the full job posting, that contains for example the description, you need to use getJobById(String). You can also follow the links.self URL, that will also lead you to the full job posting.

      • getJobsRecommendationsForUser

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<PartialJob>,HttpError> getJobsRecommendationsForUser(java.lang.String userId)
        Returns a list of recommended PartialJob postings for the specified user. A minimal job posting consists of the fields id, title, company, location, contact, published_at and links. If you want to return the full job posting, that contains for example the description, you need to use getJobById(String). You can also follow the links.self URL, that will also lead you to the full job posting.
